classKey.$comment: This is a string prefixed with 'class-name:' which represents a key to the class dictionary.

objectId.$comment: This is a string prefixed with 'object-uuid:' which represents a key to the object dictionary.

instanceVariables.$comment: This is a dictionary which contains entries indexed by the named elements of the object.

propertyNames..comment: Element names may contain letters, numbers, and underscores.

^.*..comment: Named elements may be of any value type.

indexVariables.$comment: This is an array which contains sequential, unamed entries of the object.

items..comment: Sequential elements may be of any value type.

anyOf.$comment: Metadata that describes a boolean type including value default and format specifier
Metadata that describes a null type including format specifier
Metadata that describes a generic string including default value, lower and upper length limits and format specifier.
Content media is a printable string that is specially encoded to represent a variety of binary data types. Its metadata determines how the binary data should be decoded or interpreted.
Metadata that describes a number including default value, range, divisor, and format specifier.
Metadata that describes a binary integer including default value, range, and format specifier.
Metadata that describes an octal integer including default value, range, and format specifier.
Metadata that describes a decimal integer including default value, range, and format specifier.
Metadata that describes a hexadecimal integer including default value, range, and format specifier.
These are specially strings specially tagged as object types to differentiate them from generic strings.
A boolean string consists of binary truth valued strings: true/false, yes/no, on/off, valid/invalid.
An (decimal) integer string represents a printable, base 10 integer.
A hexadecimal integer string represents a printable, base 16 integer.
A octal integer string represents a printable, base 8 integer.
A binary integer string represents a printable, base 2 integer.
A number string represents a printable, floating point number.
A null string represents a void data type.

non-string-types.$comment: Catch all non-container types that are not represented by character strings.

container-types.$comment: Catch all container types, i.e., arrays and dictionaries.

value-types.$comment: Catch all non-container types excluding non-tagged strings.
